intro: Chitonanthera, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Chitonanthera is native to tropical and subtropical regions and is often found in disturbed habitats. Its botanical features make it a common weed in agricultural fields and along roadsides.
